Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Registration into APSC 160 is via a first-year engineering timetable. If you require APSC 160, but aren't registered in a first-year engineering timetable, please register via the waitlist for your preferred lecture and laboratory section.

Please use the UBC Directory to find your instructor/TA contact information.

Course Section: ARBC_V 101-001 - Beginning Classical and Quranic Arabic I
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Beginning Classical and Quranic Arabic I. Visit amne.ubc.ca for full course descriptions.

Please note there is also a second section of this course (ARBC 101 002) that meets MWF 3-4 pm.

If the course is full or blocked, or if you do not meet restrictions for the available seats, please register for the waitlist. Students will be moved manually from the waitlist into the course section in order of registration. If the course is blocked but showing available seats, this is normal and means that waitlist transfer have not yet taken place. Email amne.undergrad@ubc.ca with any questions.

Course Section: ARBM_V 101-011 - Introductory Modern Arabic I
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Delivery Mode -This is an in-person course. Students are expected to meet in-person on the days and times listed. All courses labelled as ‘in-person’ are fully in-person for the entire term, including exams, and require in-person attendance to complete.

Waitlist Policy -All waitlists will follow a first come, first serve policy, unless specified otherwise. Once a course is full, its status will be changed to “Waitlist” and students who register will be automatically added to the waitlist.

ARTS_V 001-A_301 - BORDER CROSSINGS (A)
Course Section Definition Public Notes:
Arts One is an 18 credit program open to all students with a first-year standing. It runs from September 2024 to April 2025 and focuses on a theme. This year, we invite you to join us in exploring “Border Crossings”: https://artsone.arts.ubc.ca/themes/current-theme.

Please register into the lecture (ARTS_V 001-A_301), and one of the seminars (ARTS_V 001-A_L01, ARTS_V 001-A_L02, ARTS_V 001-A_L03, ARTS_V 001-A_L04, or ARTS_V 001-A_L05). 
 
If you see any alerts or errors before or after you register into the courses, please email us at support.fyip@ubc.ca. We will be happy to help you troubleshoot your registration into the Arts One program.
